name: Anderson, E. Forrest
title: Businessman / Contractor
notes: Forrest Anderson founded Anderson Pacific, a Bay Area construction and engineering firm that participated in Bay Bridge seismic retrofitting after the 1989 earthquake and Golden Gate Bridge structural work. He served on the boards of Castilleja School, Phillips Brooks School, and the UC Berkeley School of Engineering Alumni Society.
ngos: Castilleja School board, Phillips Brooks School board, UC Berkeley School of Engineering Alumni Society

name: Brown, Cabot
title: Founder and CEO
notes: Cabot Brown (b. 1961, San Francisco) is an investment banker with 30+ years in healthcare finance. He co-founded and ran healthcare investment banking practices at Volpe Welty, Seven Hills Partners, and GCA Savvian before founding Carabiner LLC. He served as a non-executive director of GW Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ: GWPH) from 2013 until its acquisition by Jazz Pharmaceuticals. He holds an AB cum laude from Harvard and an MBA with high distinction from Harvard Business School.
ngos: Trustee Emeritus and former Board Chair, The Thacher School; former Board Chair, Town School for Boys, San Francisco; GW Pharmaceuticals board

name: Buster, Steven K.
title: Former CEO, Mechanics Bank; Senior Vice President, Grosvenor
notes: Steven K. Buster (b. 1950, Orange County, CA) spent 35 years in banking including stints in London with First Interstate Bank and Singapore with Standard Chartered Bank. He served as CEO of Mechanics Bank (Richmond, CA) from 2004 until later, during which time the bank substantially grew profits. He also served a two-year term as COO for the Los Angeles County District Attorney and is currently at Grosvenor Property Americas.
ngos: Bay Area Crime Stoppers (chairman); Alameda County Sheriff's Air Squadron

name: Butler, Vincent K. III
title: Founder / Real Estate Developer
notes: Vincent 'Buzz' K. Butler III founded Lake Street Company, a Northern California real estate development firm specializing in creative mixed-use retail, commercial, multi-family, industrial, and office projects. Notable projects include Hidden Brook Golf Course in Vallejo, West Gate Mixed Use in San Leandro, and the Napa Valley Gateway Business Park.

name: Campbell, Duncan H.
title: Founder / Investor
notes: Duncan Campbell grew Campbell Global, a timberland investment management firm responsible for more than 3.1 million acres of land worldwide before selling it. After the sale he founded Friends of the Children, an organization providing paid mentors to at-risk youth. He graduated from the University of Oregon.

name: Cerruti, Thomas E. K.
title: Attorney / Partner
notes: Thomas E. K. Cerruti (b. February 20, 1952, Berkeley, CA) earned a BA from Claremont McKenna College (1974) and a JD from UC Hastings College of Law (1977). He is an active California Bar member (bar no. 127140, admitted 1987) practicing in La Jolla, California, specializing in business law, cooperatives, and real estate matters. He also holds the Order of St. John.

name: Charles, Glen G.
title: Co-Creator / Writer / Producer
notes: Glen Charles (b. February 8, 1943, Henderson, NV) co-created the NBC sitcom Cheers (1982-1993) with his brother Les Charles and director James Burrows under the Charles/Burrows/Charles production company. He and Les previously wrote for M*A*S*H, The Mary Tyler Moore Show, and Taxi. They won multiple Emmy Awards for Outstanding Comedy Series and Outstanding Writing.

name: Drakoulias, George
title: Record Producer / A&R Executive
notes: George Drakoulias (b. 1965, Syosset, NY) is a music producer and former A&R executive at American Recordings (Rick Rubin's label). He signed and produced The Black Crowes' debut album Shake Your Money Maker (5M+ US copies), The Jayhawks, and The Freewheelers, and also produced records for Primal Scream, Screaming Trees, Dan Penn, and Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers.

name: Eberhardt, Douglass M. II
title: Chairman and CEO
notes: Douglass M. Eberhardt II graduated from University of the Pacific (1989) and became the 9th president in Bank of Stockton's 157-year history (California's oldest bank still operating under its original charter, founded 1867). He worked his way up from a management trainee at Bank of New York before returning to lead the family institution. His father Douglass M. Eberhardt I was the previous chairman and CEO.
ngos: University of the Pacific Board of Regents

name: Engs, Stuart R. Jr.
title: Owner / President
notes: Stuart Rawlings Engs (b. May 28, 1935, Oakland, CA; d. May 15, 2016, San Francisco) attended Cate School and UC Berkeley and served as a U.S. Marine Corps Captain. He spent most of his adult life in Reno, Nevada as owner of Truck Parts & Equipment Co. and was appointed by the Governor to the Nevada State Gaming Commission from 1979-1984.

name: Fish, Jason M.
employer: Alliance Partners LLC / Sebastes Capital Management
title: Co-Founder / Managing Director; President
notes: Jason M. Fish (Princeton '80) co-founded CapitalSource Inc. in 2000 with future Congressman John Delaney, serving as Vice Chairman and CIO until 2007 after it was capitalized at $500M+. Previously he was a managing member at Farallon Capital Management (1992-2000) and a Senior Vice President at Lehman Brothers. He co-founded Alliance Partners LLC in 2011 and serves as President of Sebastes Capital Management.
ngos: Teach for America Bay Area (chairman); Princeton Institute for International and Regional Studies Advisory Council

name: Gamble, Launce L.
employer: Gamble Partners / LJ Trust Company LLC
title: Principal / Real Estate Manager
notes: Launce Edwin Gamble (1936-2025, d. February 9, 2025) was a San Francisco investor from a prominent Napa County ranching family. He attended Stanford University and UC Davis (farming economics), then managed family ranches in Napa County including the Knoxville Mine before establishing a family office in San Francisco. He was a former trustee of the Bay Area Discovery Museum and the Bancroft Library.
ngos: Bay Area Discovery Museum (former trustee); Bancroft Library (trustee); Cathedral School, Santa Catalina School (trustee)

name: Hauser, W. Kurt
title: Chairman / Investment Manager
notes: W. Kurt Hauser (BA and MBA from Stanford) is a San Francisco-based investment economist and chairman of Wentworth, Hauser & Violich, an investment management firm. He is Chairman Emeritus of the Hoover Institution at Stanford University and known for 'Hauser's Law,' his empirical observation that US federal revenues remain roughly constant as a percentage of GDP regardless of top marginal tax rates.

name: Jones, Ellis
title: Chairman (former CEO)
notes: Ellis B. Jones (Yale School of Management, UC Berkeley) spent 25+ years in investment banking and private equity. He was Head of West Coast Investment Banking at Wasserstein Perella and earlier ran the Los Angeles Investment Banking and Hotel/Gaming Group at Salomon Brothers (1988-1994). He co-founded Wasserstein & Co. in 2001 and served as CEO through 2012, then became Chairman. He served on Lazard's Board of Directors and previously on the boards of IMAX, Odwalla, and All-Clad.

name: Kuechler, Henry N. IV
title: Mining executive
notes: Henry 'Jack' Kuechler IV is a 4th-generation Californian and Menlo Park-based mining executive affiliated with Knob Hill Mines, Inc. He holds a degree from UC Berkeley. His father, Henry Norbury Kuechler III (1938-2015), was the former president and owner of Knob Hill Mines. The Kuechler family has operated in California since the early 1900s.

name: Lundquist, Weyman J.
title: Managing Director; Attorney
notes: Weyman Ivan Lundquist (1930-2019) graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Dartmouth (1952) and earned his JD from Harvard Law School (1955). A Fellow of the American College of Trial Lawyers, he was admitted to practice in Massachusetts, Alaska, California, and Vermont. His practice areas included financial markets, consumer protection, and complex litigation. In his later years he became Managing Director of Technology Licensing Division at West Coast Magnetics in Stockton, CA.
ngos: American College of Trial Lawyers (Fellow); ABA Litigation Section (editor)

name: Merriman, Gregory R.
title: Unknown
notes: Limited public biographical information found. No verified SEC, LinkedIn, or news source confirmed for this specific individual.

name: Moore, Charles E. IV
title: Retired CEO
notes: Charles Moore IV is a retired real estate executive formerly with McGuire Real Estate in San Francisco. Limited additional public biographical information is available.

name: Noble, William L.
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical profile clearly matching a 'William L. Noble' from Bohemian Grove's Roaring Camp was identified. Name is common with multiple individuals in California.

name: Ohleyer, Mark
title: Vice President of Sales and Marketing
notes: Mark Ohleyer is based in Lafayette, California and serves as Vice President of Sales and Marketing at Clearwater Paper Corporation (NYSE: CLW). He grew the company's paperboard division to a billion-dollar top line. He is also a partner in 55th St. LLC, a private investment vehicle.

name: Rosekrans, Adolph S.
title: Heir / Landowner
notes: Adolph S. Rosekrans is a member of the prominent San Francisco Rosekrans family, descendants of Alma Emma Spreckels (daughter of sugar magnate Adolph B. Spreckels). Adolph is co-owner of Runnymede Sculpture Farm in Woodside, CA — a major Bay Area outdoor sculpture installation — along with his siblings. He was noted as the oldest descendant of the John D. Spreckels branch of the family.

name: Rosekrans, John S.
title: Businessman / Heir
notes: John Newton Rosekrans Jr. (1928-2001) was heir to the Spreckels sugar fortune and co-founder (with John Bowes) of Kransco Group Co. in 1963, which by the 1990s marketed Hula Hoops, Frisbees, and Hackey Sacks. He sold Kransco to Mattel in 1994 for $175M in annual sales. He served on the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco board and was a noted arts patron with homes in San Francisco, Paris, and Venice.
ngos: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco (board of trustees)

name: Rosekrans, Peter R.
title: Heir / Landowner
notes: Peter R. Rosekrans is a son of John N. Rosekrans Jr. and co-inheritor of the family's Runnymede Sculpture Farm in Woodside, CA. He is part of the San Francisco Rosekrans family, descendants of the Spreckels sugar dynasty through Alma Emma Spreckels Rosekrans.

name: Rutherford, George W.
title: Unknown
notes: No clear public biographical profile matching a 'George W. Rutherford' from the Roaring Camp was identified. Multiple individuals with this name exist including a prominent UCSF public health professor, but no confirmed match for a Bohemian Grove member.

name: Stewart, Jeffrey H.

notes: No specific public biographical profile for a Jeffrey H. Stewart associated with Roaring Camp was clearly identified. Multiple professionals with this name exist in California.

name: Stough, Brooks
employer: Gunderson Dettmer Stough Villeneuve Franklin & Hachigian LLP
title: Founding Partner
notes: Brooks Stough is a founding partner of Gunderson Dettmer (headquartered in Silicon Valley) and one of Silicon Valley's most recognized corporate and securities lawyers. He holds a JD, MBA, and BA from Stanford University. He focuses on representing public companies in capital markets transactions with Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley as underwriting clients, and advising on M&A and venture capital financings. He appeared in Ariba Inc. and Theravance Inc. 10-K SEC filings.

name: Sullivan, Brian J.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed public biographical profile for a Brian J. Sullivan associated with the Roaring Camp at Bohemian Grove was found. Multiple Brian Sullivans exist in California business circles.

name: Sullivan, John L. II
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed public biographical profile for a John L. Sullivan II associated with the Roaring Camp was found. Multiple businessmen and attorneys with this name exist in California.

name: Sutton, Garrett Zook
title: Attorney / CEO
notes: Garrett Sutton is a corporate attorney, best-selling author, and member of Robert Kiyosaki's 'Rich Dad Advisors' group. Licensed in Nevada and California, he received his JD from UC Hastings (1978) and has practiced asset protection and corporate formation law for 35+ years. He has authored multiple best-sellers in the Rich Dad series including Start Your Own Corporation and Loopholes of Real Estate.
ngos: Sierra Kids Foundation (board/secretary, since 2003); Nevada Museum of Art (board, since 2003); American Baseball Foundation, Birmingham AL (board, since 1994)

name: Taylor, Matthew J.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed public biographical profile for a Matthew J. Taylor associated with the Roaring Camp was found. Multiple professionals with this name exist in California.

name: Thacher, David J.
title: Board Member; Venture Capitalist
notes: David J. Thacher is a venture capitalist and business consultant specializing in technology start-ups and business software. He was a U.S. Foreign Service officer from 1979-1987, serving as vice-consul in Niger and as an economic specialist on trade negotiations. From 1988-2007 he worked at Microsoft Corporation in engineering and marketing management, growing the CRM software division to a multi-hundred-million-dollar business. He serves on the Wilbur-Ellis Company board.
ngos: The Nature Conservancy of Washington (board member and past chairman)

name: Thacher, John P.
title: Executive Chairman of the Board (former President & CEO)
notes: John P. Thacher (UC Berkeley, BA 1977) is Executive Chairman of Wilbur-Ellis, a San Francisco-based agriculture and specialty chemicals company. He served 25 years as president of Cuvaison Winery in Napa, joined Wilbur-Ellis as VP of Strategic Planning in 2001, became President and CEO in 2006, and transitioned to Executive Chairman in 2018. He is a grandson of Brayton Wilbur Sr.
ngos: Rabobank North America (board); Napa Valley Vintners (board); Di Rosa Foundation (board); Pacific Institute (board)

name: Thacher, William L.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed public biographical profile matching a William L. Thacher in Bohemian Grove's Roaring Camp was found. The name appears in Wilbur-Ellis family heritage (descendants of the Thacher/Wilbur family), but no specific individual of this name with board or executive roles was confirmed.

name: Topham, Ned
title: CEO / Principal
notes: Ned Topham is principal of Topham Co. Inc., a San Francisco-based business. The Topham family has been associated with United Artists Theatres. Limited additional public biographical information is available.

name: Towle, C. Griffith
title: Partner
notes: C. Griffith Towle (Charles Griffith Towle, b. c.1963) is a California State Bar-certified specialist in Franchise and Distribution Law. He earned his BA from UC Santa Barbara (1986) and JD from UC Hastings (1989), and is a partner at Bartko Pavia LLP in San Francisco. He is Co-Editor of the ABA's Franchise Litigation Handbook and former Co-Chair of the Franchise Law Committee of the California State Bar.
ngos: American Bar Association (Franchise Litigation Handbook co-editor)

name: Adams, Peter S.
title: Unknown

name: Berry, Kenneth G.
title: Financial professional / Options floor broker
notes: Kenneth Anthony Berry (b. July 5, 1942, San Francisco Bay Area; d. 2019) attended St. Ignatius Preparatory High School and the University of San Francisco. He worked as an OTC trader for Reynolds and Co. (later Mitchum, Templeton & Jones) and ended his career as an options floor broker on the Pacific Coast Exchange. He was active as a youth athletic coach in Moraga, CA.

name: Cella, Peter Michael
title: President and CEO
notes: Peter Michael Cella is President and CEO of Beere & Purves Inc., one of California's largest insurance General Agencies (founded 1929), headquartered in Walnut Creek, CA. He holds a BS from UC Berkeley (1980-1984). The Cella family has a long history in the California wine industry.

name: Kallman, Craig A.
title: Chief Music Officer (former Chairman/CEO, Atlantic Records)
notes: Craig Kallman (b. 1965, Manhattan, NY) is one of the most prominent figures in the US recording industry. He founded Big Beat Records while still in college and joined Atlantic Records in 1991, becoming co-president in 2002 and Chairman/CEO in 2005. During his tenure he signed Ed Sheeran, Bruno Mars, Trey Songz, Wiz Khalifa, and many others. In 2024 he transitioned to Chief Music Officer of Warner Music Group. He and Julie Greenwald were the 2023 Grammy Salute to Industry Icons honorees.

name: Kenney, Mark P.
title: Partner (deceased)
notes: Mark Joseph Kenney (b. May 18, 1952, Denver, CO; d. March 26, 2022) was a prominent San Francisco attorney at Severson & Werson. A Root-Tilden scholar and Moot Court champion at NYU School of Law, he clerked for the Honorable Richard P. Matsch (U.S.D.C. Colorado) and joined Severson in 1980. He specialized in civil trials, class actions, complex federal disputes, and law enforcement litigation.

name: Knox, Northrup R.
title: Banker / Heir
notes: Northrup R. Knox Jr. is the son of Northrup R. Knox Sr. (1928-1998), who was a Buffalo banker and co-founder of the Buffalo Sabres. The son is based in Dedham, Massachusetts. His father was the third-generation Knox family chairman of Marine Midland Bank and the 1959-1969 World Court Tennis Champion.

name: Laufer, Theodore M.
title: Attorney
notes: Theodore M. Laufer is an attorney based in Los Angeles, California, licensed with the California State Bar. Limited public biographical information is available beyond his legal practice.

name: Molinari, John A.
title: Former San Francisco Supervisor
notes: John L. Molinari served as a San Francisco Supervisor in the 1970s-1980s and ran for mayor in 1987, losing to Art Agnos. He initially identified as a Republican before switching to the Democratic Party. He is affiliated with the Golden Gate University board. His father, John Baptist Molinari (1909-2004), was an Appellate Justice of the California Court of Appeal.

name: Murray, John Jr.
title: Businessman
notes: John Joseph Murray (b. June 24, 1935; d. June 6, 2025) was a fourth-generation San Francisco native son. He was the husband of Maryanne Kavanaugh Murray for 67 years and devoted father of five children. Limited public information on specific business career is available.
